# Emergent Scholarship

> A framework for the entire knowledge creation pipeline: from identifying problems worth solving, to learning systematically, to sharing what you've learned in ways that matter.

This site is maintained by Michael Rowe, an academic and researcher working on technology-enhanced scholarship and artificial intelligence in health professions education at the University of Lincoln.

## What this site offers

- **AI Literacy Framework**: A comprehensive approach to developing AI literacy across six dimensions (access/recognition, critical evaluation, functional application, creation/communication, ethical awareness, contextual judgement)
- **AI Literacy Course**: A developmental course for academics moving from foundation through substitution, adaptation, to transformation
- **Essays and Analysis**: Scholarly writing on AI in education, learning alignment, taste and judgement in human-AI systems
- **Frameworks and Policies**: Practical resources including classroom AI policies and curriculum design frameworks

## Primary audience

Health professions educators and those involved in developing practitioners at any level, including medical educators, clinical supervisors, curriculum designers, and faculty development professionals.

## Key resources

- /Courses/AI-literacy/ - Full AI literacy course for academics
- /Frameworks/AI-literacy-development-framework/ - Framework for embedding AI literacy into existing courses
- /Policies/classroom-policy-AI-use/ - Template classroom policy for AI use
- /Notes/AI-literacy/ - Core concepts of AI literacy
- /Essays/taste-and-judgement/ - Essay on taste and judgement in human-AI systems

## Content structure

- **Essays**: Developed arguments and analysis
- **Posts**: Shorter, timely pieces
- **Notes**: Atomic concepts and working ideas
- **Courses**: Structured learning sequences
- **Frameworks**: Practical tools for educators
